active_contexts.statement: China Q4 GDP 4.5% y/y; Dec retail sales 0.9% y/y while industrial output 5.2% y/y.
active_contexts.market_link: China demand vs supply mix is a global risk-tone input; can spill into ES/NQ and USD via growth expectations and commodity-linked channels.
active_contexts.notes: Headline beat/meet vs forecast, but consumption/investment weak.

active_contexts.statement: China 2025 fixed-asset investment -3.8% y/y; property investment -17.2%; property sales area -8.7%.
active_contexts.market_link: China property/investment softness is a medium-term global growth and risk-sentiment overhang; relevant for US equities and cyclicals.
active_contexts.notes: Annual prints typically carry multi-session narrative weight.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone CPI final 1.9% y/y (prev 2.0%); core 2.3% y/y unchanged (final).
active_contexts.market_link: EU disinflation framing can influence global rates/FX via relative policy paths; affects UST duration (ZN/ZB) and EUR (6E).
active_contexts.notes: Final print; usually lower incremental impact than flash.

active_contexts.statement: Canada Dec CPI 2.4% y/y (Nov 2.2%); CPI m/m -0.2%; ex-gasoline CPI 3.0% y/y.
active_contexts.market_link: Canada inflation surprises can move CAD rates/FX and spill into broader rates risk appetite; indirect relevance to UST complex and ES/NQ.
active_contexts.notes: StatCan flagged GST/HST-base effects in y/y comparison.

active_contexts.statement: US MOO imbalance: S&P 500 -$1.10B; Nasdaq 100 -$0.41B; Dow -$0.42B; Mag7 -$0.19B.
active_contexts.market_link: Large open/close imbalance prints can help explain late-day/into-open index-futures volatility; effect typically short-lived.

active_contexts.statement: Polymarket (asof Jan 19): Jan FOMC no-change 96.45%; cut 25bp 3.45% (event end Jan 28).
active_contexts.market_link: Near-term policy odds are a key driver for ZT/ZF and duration-sensitive equities (ES/NQ); USD often follows real-rate repricing.
active_contexts.notes: Odds proxy; tails can reprice on data/speakers.

active_contexts.statement: FRED snapshot: CPI core y/y 2.86% (Dec 2025); CPI headline y/y 3.03% (Dec 2025).
active_contexts.market_link: Inflation baseline anchors sensitivity of ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) into PCE/CPI releases and Fed communication.
active_contexts.notes: PCE series in snapshot appears lagged (latest Sep 2025).

watchlist.statement: US calendar shows a Bank Holiday on Jan 19 (today), which can thin liquidity in some sessions/venues.
watchlist.market_link: Holiday conditions can amplify headline-driven moves and widen intraday swings across ES/NQ and Treasury futures due to reduced depth.
watchlist.notes: Treat as microstructure context; not a fundamental driver.

headline_memory.headline: China Q4 GDP 4.5% y/y; 2025 GDP 5.0% y/y; retail sales 0.9% y/y and investment -3.8% highlight demand lag.
headline_memory.why_sticky: Keeps China growth/demand mix in mind for global risk tone beyond the initial print.

headline_memory.headline: Canada Dec CPI rose 2.4% y/y (Nov 2.2%); CPI m/m -0.2%; StatCan cited GST/HST-base effects in y/y change.
headline_memory.why_sticky: Inflation surprise context for North American rates narratives into next key US inflation prints.

upcoming_catalysts.name: ADP Weekly Employment Change
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Labor-growth signal can shift front-end rates pricing and spill into equity index futures via policy-path sensitivity.

upcoming_catalysts.name: President Trump Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Policy/trade/fiscal signals can reprice risk premia, USD, and rates expectations; impact depends on topic and Q&A.

upcoming_catalysts.name: Final GDP q/q
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Revisions can affect growth narrative and rate expectations, though final releases often have smaller incremental impact than advance prints.

upcoming_catalysts.name: Core PCE Price Index m/m
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Core PCE is the Fedâ€™s preferred inflation gauge; surprises tend to move ZT/ZF and spill into ES/NQ via real-rate repricing.

upcoming_catalysts.name: Flash Manufacturing & Services PMI
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: High-frequency read on activity/prices can shift growth vs inflation balance, moving rates and risk simultaneously.
